summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It details procedures for public and press access via audio feed and limited in-person viewing at the courthouse due to COVID-19 restrictions, and mentions alleged victims' rights to be heard.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order schedules an arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, detailing the logistics for the upcoming remote proceedings and public access.

events.title: Maxwell Remote Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: A video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Previous Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued a previous order referenced in this document (Dkt. No. 10), likely concerning courthouse access procedures.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a remote video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell for July 14, 2020, at 1 pm.

Public and press access to the hearing is provided via a live audio phone feed with a 500-caller capacity, and limited in-person viewing at the courthouse due to COVID-19 social distancing restrictions.
The order references alleged victims' rights under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771(a)(4) to be heard at the bail hearing and instructs the U.S. Attorney's Office to provide their information to the court.
The order is issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan and cites a previous order from July 7, 2020, regarding courthouse entry protocols during the pandemic.
